The patient's medical history and diagnostic tests support the diagnosis of unspecified atherosclerosis of the autologous vein bypass graft in the right leg.The patient is prescribed antiplatelet medication, statins, and advised to follow a structured exercise program to improve arterial circulation.The patient responded well to treatment and was discharged with instructions for medication adherence and regular follow-up appointments.65MaleCaucasian

6280.explanation_text: Atherosclerosis of autologous vein bypass graft(s) of the extremities with gangrene, right leg.
6280.symptom_text: The patient has a history of autologous vein bypass graft in the right leg due to peripheral artery disease.The patient presents with pain, discoloration, coldness, and numbness in the right leg along with visible gangrene.Doppler ultrasound shows reduced blood flow in the autologous vein bypass graft in the right leg. No signs of atherosclerosis in native arteries or other extremities.Immediate surgical consultation for revascularization, intravenous antibiotics for infection control, and pain management. 6290.symptom_text: The patient has a history of heavy tobacco use for the past 15 years.The patient presents with severe pain in the distal parts of both lower extremities, especially in the toes and fingers. There is a clear history of heavy tobacco use, and the angiography confirms the characteristic segmental occlusions in the affected arteries.The patient has been advised to stop smoking immediately.
